page.title: 06CUSTOMS IN WALKINGTON.
page.content: THERE ARE NO SURVIVING OLD CUSTOMS IN THE AREA.THE OLDEST ANNUAL EVENT IS A 26 YEAR OLD WHIT SPORTS DAY.IT STARTS WITH A FANCY DRESS PARADE,THEN A PARTY FOR UNDER 12'S,CHILDRENS RACES FOR SMALL CASH PRIZES,SOME ADULT RACES,A MENS TUG_OF_WAR,AND FINALLY A FAMILY 1_MILE FUN RUN.ALL COMPETE FIERCELY. 18 YEARS AGO WAS REVIVED THE FARMING CUSTOM OF WORKERS USING THE FARM CARTS FOR A DAY OUT AFTER THE HARVEST.TODAY THE EVENT STARTS WITH A BARN_DANCE ON THE FIRST FRIDAY IN JUNE.ON SATURDAY IS A VICTORIAN GARDEN PARTY,AND SUNDAY SEES THE PARADE TO BEVERLEY AND BACK WITH MANY DIFFERENT HORSES AND HORSE DRAWN VEHICLES AND ALL THE PEOPLE IN VICTORIAN COSTUME.THIS IS "THE" EVENT. 15 YEARS AGO BEGAN A "CHRISTMAS POND VISIT".CAROL SINGING TO A STEAM ORGAN HERALDS FATHER CHRISTMAS CROSSING THE POND TO GIVE CHILDREN BAGS OF SWEETS.
